title: 1934 Philadelphia Eagles season
text:
The <a href="1934%20NFL%20season">1934</a> <a href="Philadelphia%20Eagles">Philadelphia Eagles</a> season was their second in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">league</a>. The team failed to improve on their <a href="1933%20Philadelphia%20Eagles%20season">previous output</a> of 3–5–1, losing seven games. They failed to qualify for the playoffs for the second consecutive season. However, on an interesting note, all of Philadelphia's wins were shutouts. Not only that, but the team allowed 7.7 points per game (the best in franchise history). They allowed 6 points or less 5 times, and were 4–1 in those games.
Off Season.
The Eagles held their preseason training camp in the New Jersey resort city of <a href="Atlantic%20City%2C%20New%20Jersey">Atlantic City, New Jersey</a>.
Playoffs.
In their second year of existence the Eagles failed to play for the NFL Championship.
Roster.
"(All time <a href="List%20of%20Philadelphia%20Eagles%20players">List of Philadelphia Eagles players</a> in franchise history)"
Being a 2nd year expansion team the Eagles were mostly stocked with Rookies and 1st or 2nd years players.
This was before the <a href="NFL%20Draft">NFL Draft</a> was started. All the NFL teams competed for the same players in an open market.
A List of the 1933 Philadelphia Eagles.
